attributes.title: Physical stock count.
attributes.description:
+ Stock count of items at the branch was done on 19.02.25 and the table below shows the same.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -68 loaves.

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -683pieces.

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: + The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.

value: + More improvement measures will be initiated.
+ Control is ok and will maintain the trend.

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 19.02.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that there are strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weights analysis.
attributes.description:
Dough weights for 400g CT white bread were sampled on 19.02.25 and the table below shows that weights were within the set standards.

Dough weights sampled on 19.02.2025:(2 shift @7.30pm)
attributes.recommendation: + Dough weights sampled were within the set standards and this is commendable.

value: + We will maintain this. Dough dividers are monitored to ensure compliance.
+ We will continue to monitor dough dividing weights to ensure compliance.
+ Dough weights were sampled to ensure compliance.
+ Standard dough weights noted ensures standard bread weight production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Random check of dough weights to ensure compliance.

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
+Packed bread weights were sampled on 20.02.25;

+ Several underweight loaves were noted .

+ This is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
+ Noted underweight bread should be addressed.

+ Dough dividers should ensure adherence to set standard weights for standard bread weight production.

value:
+ We had a slicing machine breakdown and bread could have overcooled on cooling wires resulting to underweight bread.

+ Noted underweight loaves will be addressed.
+ We will address noted underweight bread.
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+ Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

+ High overweight bread on the other end deprives the company revenues because this lowers expected yields.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis
attributes.description:
+ Bread production and market damage rate was analysed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.

+ The rates were higher than the expected (those allowed). This is shown on the table below.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
+ The management should focus on efforts to address high bread damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

+ Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high bread damages.
+ Noted high production and market damages will be addressed.

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

+ Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ High production and market damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized. Lost revenue during this period was at least Kshs. 23,611.50.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages are within the allowed rates.

attributes.title: Raw materials consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ yeast and utto consumption standard quantities was analyzed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.

+ Quantities consumed analyzed matched those set.

+ Below is a table illustrating this;
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set standard raw materials consumption quantities is commendable.

value: + Raw materials were consumed as expected.
+ We will ensure that raw materials are consumed as expected.
+ This exercise was conducted to determine if set consumption standards for raw materials were adhered to as per company policy.
+ Adherence to set consumption quantities ensures controlled misuse of the same and high quality bread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that raw materials consumption is per the set standards.

attributes.title: Cash count
attributes.description:
+ Physical cash analysis was done on 19.02.25.

+ Expected cash matched SAP cash analysis balance.

+ Analysis is tabulated below.

Minimal variances were noted during spot-check
attributes.recommendation: + Observed cash control is commendable.

value: + Proper cash control will be maintained.
+ This trend will be maintained
+ A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring cash control SOPs are adhered to.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
+ Spot check was done at the mini shop on 19.02.25 whereby bread balance was reconciled with sales and quantity transferred.

 

·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 19.02.2025.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.

value: + Accountability and controls noted at the mini shop will always be ensured.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards
+ Mini shop SOPs are followed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring mini shop SOPs are adhered to.

attributes.title: Bread yields analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Mixing charts/summaries yields were analyzed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25 and the yields were compared to those of SAP system for the same period.

+ Actual yields were found to be matching those on SAP system.

+ Analysis is tabulated below;

value: + We will ensure that set yields are realized.
+ We will maintain the trend.
+ Mixing charts yields were compared to SAP yields to ensure actual yields are reflected.
+ Matching of registers ensures that bread produced is accounted for.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set standard bread yields.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
+ Production efficiency at the branch was analyzed from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.

+ production inefficiency was noted whereby 8production staff were surplus and this increased production costs by Kshs. 8,692.80.

+ The table below further illustrates this;

PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 18/02/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should ensure proper production  planning to address production inefficiency noted.

value:
·          Branch management should ensure proper production planning to address noted production inefficiency.

·          Proper bread packing planning will also check packing inefficiency.

       Costs incurred from operational inefficiencies should be recovered through surcharge.
+ We will put necessary measures to improve on noted operational inefficiencies.
+ Noted packing and production inefficiencies will be addressed.
This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs
Production inefficiency increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ To ensure that set standard production efficiency is realized.

attributes.title: packing efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
+ Analysis was done from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25.

+ Packing inefficiency was noted whereby expected packers to be hired were surpassed by 11packers increasing production costs by Kshs. 10,032.

+ The table below further tabulates this.

PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 18/02/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should address packing inefficiency and costs incurred from surplus packing wages payments should be recovered.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis from 01.02.25 - 18.02.25 showed that packers hired were more than expected bread to be packed by 11staff.

This is illustrated on the table below;

PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 18/02/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + The branch management should plan properly and ensure that packers are hired with respect to expected bread to be packed.
